subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... Exactly. ... I see. As I think about it, I d say that already the method signature is over-engineered. If the method only has to be able to reverse one
messageBody:
hyysguyang wrote:

> I think what you say is as below:
>
> public Object reverse(String str) {
> return "technology devolopment software a is Tdd";
> }

Exactly.

> But in my opinion ,I think that string 'Tdd is a software ...' in
> test is duplicated with before string in some ways ,then I refactor
> and generate the final complex code .May be I made a mistakes on
> here,do you think so£¿

I see.

As I think about it, I'd say that already the method signature is
over-engineered. If the method only has to be able to reverse one hard
coded string, we don't really need to pass in that string:

public String reverseTddSentence() {
return "technology devolopment software a is Tdd";
}

But perhaps the real problem is that this is kind of a bogus
requirement? Where is it coming from?

Cheers, Ilja
